comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Could be Umberto (Humbert) From www.ultimateitaly.com/culture-antropology/umberto-ii.html "Umberto II, also known as Humbert II by the anglicized world, was born Prince of Piedmont on September 15, 1904 in Turin, as the second son of Victor Emmanuel III, who also occupied the throne of Italy just before his son did." I'm puzzled by the "second" above -- perhaps an earlier son died. The Washington times., August 06, 1914, HOME EDITION, Page 8 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1914-08-06/ed-... indicates that Victor Emmanuel and his wife Helena had four children and Prince Humbert was the older of two sons and heir to the throne. Anyway, this is almost certainly en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umberto_II_of_Italy

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you swanq, for your research. We'll fill in his name the next time we update the record.
